clues.text: Type of shirt that proverbially suits you to this letter

Chess notation for the piece that can move exactly one square in any direction

This greeting is a shortening of Hebrew for "Peace be with you"

Unlike a more popular synonym, welina means "greetings" in this language but does not mean "goodbye"
This 2-word Spanish greeting means "what's happening"
Also a dance, this word is commonly used as a Swahili greeting

Dickens' tale of a seemingly endless lawsuit is contained in the 900+ pages of this "homely" novel

An atom or molecule that has an unpaired electron is called by this "liberated" name & can damage your cells

Jerry Lewis was among those who desperately wanted to play him, J.D. Salinger's most famous character

rounds.category: YOU CAN'T TAKE IT WITH YOU
rounds.comments: (Alex: The whole category is devoted to items that, according to the TSA, you cannot take with you on the plane or even check it in your baggage.)

clues.text: Should really go without saying: none of this Nobel stuff patented in 1867

None of this element used to disinfect pools & spas--relax, they'll use it at the resort!
No booze above 70% alcohol, this proof
No to the Note7 model of this smartphone

One symbolic representation of Christ is as the paschal type of this animal
Gary Anderson designed 3 chasing arrows as the symbol for this; the negative space on the inside resembles a pine tree
Long a symbol of communism, this pair represents the union of worker & peasant
Because of his days as a sailor, the founder of this department store used a red star as its symbol
